title: How to Make a Tuna Roll‐Up

methods.name: Making a Strawberry and Apple Tuna Roll-Up

steps.headline: Mix a can of tuna into a bowl along with some mayonnaise.
De-core a fresh red apple.
steps.description: Proceed to dice it into small squares. Also cut up a tomato and have some lettuce ready.

steps.headline: Add a fair amount of diced apple into the tuna and proceed to mix again.
steps.description: This gives the tuna a slightly sweet taste with some crunch.

steps.headline: Prep the tortilla.
steps.description: Lay it flat on a plate and lightly glaze it with some strawberry preserves. Remember, not too much!

steps.headline: Lay down a bed of lettuce onto the roll up, allowing the strawberry jam to "glue" it to the wrap.
Top it off with the tuna and fold the wrap.
steps.description: Take both sides and fold them together so they don't quite touch. Hold the sides down and roll the bottom up until it's neat. This should keep things simple and not messy.

methods.name: Making a Traditional Savory Tuna Roll-Up

steps.headline: Get three cans of tuna (this is supposed to last the whole week).
Drain the tuna and put into a medium bowl that won't let the smell of fish escape.
Add in as much mayonnaise as you desire, depending upon the thickness or wetness you like.
(optional)  If you like the taste of raw onions, go ahead and finely chop an onion.
steps.description: Don't add all of it to the tuna or the onion tastes will cover up the tuna.

steps.headline: Get out one tortilla wrap (large) or two(small).
steps.description: Slip a piece of lettuce over the tortilla, mustard (or not) and put a good amount of tuna across the middle of the tortilla(s).

text: Making a Strawberry and Apple Tuna Roll-Up Mix a can of tuna into a bowl along with some mayonnaise.  De-core a fresh red apple. Proceed to dice it into small squares. Also cut up a tomato and have some lettuce ready. Add a fair amount of diced apple into the tuna and proceed to mix again. This gives the tuna a slightly sweet taste with some crunch. Prep the tortilla. Lay it flat on a plate and lightly glaze it with some strawberry preserves. Remember, not too much! Lay down a bed of lettuce onto the roll up, allowing the strawberry jam to "glue" it to the wrap. Add the tomatoes. Top it off with the tuna and fold the wrap. Take both sides and fold them together so they don't quite touch. Hold the sides down and roll the bottom up until it's neat. This should keep things simple and not messy. Finished.  Making a Traditional Savory Tuna Roll-Up Get three cans of tuna (this is supposed to last the whole week).  Drain the tuna and put into a medium bowl that won't let the smell of fish escape.  Add in as much mayonnaise as you desire, depending upon the thickness or wetness you like.  (optional)  If you like the taste of raw onions, go ahead and finely chop an onion. Don't add all of it to the tuna or the onion tastes will cover up the tuna. Mix it all together.  Get out one tortilla wrap (large) or two(small). Slip a piece of lettuce over the tortilla, mustard (or not) and put a good amount of tuna across the middle of the tortilla(s).
